intro: Acer murrayanum, commonly known as the Murray maple, is a deciduous tree native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive palmate leaves that turn vibrant shades of red and orange in the autumn. The tree produces small, yellowish-green flowers in the spring, followed by winged seeds that are dispersed by the wind. It typically grows to a height of 10–15 meters and prefers well-drained, loamy soils. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and parks.
